sentences.english: A city of southwest India on the Arabian Sea south-southwest of Bangalore.
sentences.chinese: 哥印拜陀印度南部一城市，在孟加罗尔西南编南。

sentences.english: Bowing is the simplest and most boring mechanical movement.
sentences.chinese: 拜，是最简单不过，最枯燥不过的机械运动。

sentences.english: We saw his star as it rose, and we have come to worship him." Matthew 2:2 (NLT)
sentences.chinese: 我们在东方看见他的星，特来拜他。

sentences.english: The 11-13th century was one transitional period of Byzantine society.
sentences.chinese: 13世纪是拜占廷社会的一个转折时期。

sentences.english: In the Zhou Dynasty, the people celebrated the Mid-Autumn Festival to worship the moon.
sentences.chinese: 在周朝，人们开始庆祝仲秋并拜月。

sentences.english: It's good to worship God, so you will be blessed.
sentences.chinese: 好耶，拜多了神，神自然会保祐你啦。

sentences.english: Most of the time I spent there was with Mr. Gillespie.
sentences.chinese: 我在那里的大部分时间都是陪伴着吉尔斯拜先生。

sentences.english: Possibly, that's why people worshipped the moon.
sentences.chinese: 或许这就是人们拜月的原因。

sentences.english: And as Peter was coming in, Cornelius met him, and fell down at his feet, and worshipped him.
sentences.chinese: 彼得一进去，哥尼流就迎接他，俯伏在他脚前拜他。

sentences.english: Hong account cluster rows slim, lovely lilies to wear worship strike.
sentences.chinese: 香帐簇成排窈窕，金针穿罢拜婵娟。

sentences.english: The presenter is pleautomotive service engineersd with her new role.
sentences.chinese: 拜力克对自己的新角色很高兴。

sentences.english: My dear devotees, Please accept my humble obeisances.
sentences.chinese: 我亲爱的奉献者们，请接受我卑微的顶拜。

sentences.english: He was bound out to a blacksmith for three years.
sentences.chinese: 根据契约，他拜一位铁匠为师当三年学徒。

sentences.english: They came to him, clasped his feet and worshiped him.
sentences.chinese: 她们就上前抱住他的脚拜他。
